thread.title: Blackhawks hurting on defence following Duncan Keith injury | NHL | Hockey | Spo
thread.title_full: Blackhawks hurting on defence following Duncan Keith injury | NHL | Hockey | Spo

author: torontosun.com
title: Blackhawks hurting on defence following Duncan Keith injury | NHL | Hockey | Spo
text:
An already wafer-thin Chicago Blackhawks defence has suffered a stinging blow, one that will cost them the services of the reigning Conn Smythe trophy winner for at least a month.
And let’s face it -- however coach Joel Quenneville decides on splitting up the suddenly-available blueline minutes, there is no way that Duncan Keith can be replaced.
Keith underwent successful surgery to repair a right knee meniscal tear, the Blackhawks announced Tuesday morning. According to team physician Dr. Michael Terry, who performed the operation at Northwestern Memorial Hospital, Keith should “return to full hockey activities in approximately 4-6 weeks.”
Keith logged his usual 25-plus minutes during the Hawks 4-1 win over Columbus on Saturday. Since 2008, Keith has not missed more than eight games in any one season.
Keith’s injury leaves the Hawks with a Top Four on the back end of Brent Seabrook, Niklas Hjalmarsson, Trevor Daley and David Rundblad.
